Exciting News!! Congratulations to Dr. David Blattner - the recipient of the CIO of the Year ORBIE Award for the Education category and presented through the Charlotte CIO Leadership Association.

Dr. Blattner is the Chief Technology Officer for Rowan-Salisbury Schools.

The ORBIE Award recognizes chief information officers (CIO) who have demonstrated excellence in technology leadership. Finalists and winners are selected through an independent peer review process, led by prior ORBIE recipients. The ORBIE is the premier technology executive recognition program of its kind. In previous years, Blattner has been nominated as a finalist for this prestigious award – an honor in and of itself.

Hello RSS Families,

As we look forward to welcoming students back to school Monday, we ask for your patience and flexibility.

We recognize that there will be adjustments that need to be made to some student schedules and transfers. Until these adjustments can be finalized, we ask that you check the parent portal in PowerSchool after 2 pm on Friday to confirm the school where your child will need to report on Monday – this is very important!

We are implementing extreme safety measures to keep our students and staff safe, so it is imperative that this schedule be explicitly followed on Monday as we account for each student.

Please look for a welcome message from your school on Sunday evening.

You may contact your school that is currently listed in PowerSchool to answer your questions, concerns and to make adjustments if at all possible.

We thank you again for your patience in working with us as we open this historical new school year.

Following today’s announcement by NC Governor Roy Cooper, we will continue remote eLearning and meal distributions throughout the remainder of this school year. All Rowan-Salisbury School buildings will remain closed.

As much as this saddens us, we will have a plan to share with you very soon on how we will end this school year.

Many thanks to all our teachers, students, staff, parents, and community as we all work together to continue to nourish, grow, and care for our children and for each other.

Please be sure to visit our website at www.rssed.org for updates. Parents are also receiving our 'Parent Communication Guide' that is emailed through Connect-ED and available on our website.

We are prepared to continue to do all we can for the safety and well-being of our students, staff and families. Should you have any questions, please stay in touch with your child’s teacher or call your child’s school. We are here for you.

Thank you for all your support as we continue to work together through these difficult times.

The texting service is also available in Spanish by texting COMIDA to 877-877.

In addition, car-rider lines will be open for drive-through meal pick up, at the schools, from 11 am–1 pm.

Meals are free of charge.

Today Bostian Elementary says "goodbye" to Lisa Sigmon who served as Bostian’s principal for the previous 15 years.

AND... Bostian says "hello" to Cory Stirewalt as their new principal.

Former principals at Bostian include the following:

Ethan Shive: 1943-1964
Curtis Helms: 1964-1966
Gary Sherrill: 1966-1993
Ray Rivers: 1993-2004
Lisa Sigmon: 2004-Sept 30, 2019
Cory Stirewalt: 2019 -

Thank you Mrs. Sigmon, and welcome Mr. Stirewalt!
